channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: An ancient disease makes yet another comeback
item.description: Why cholera is striking in Africa. It's a disease that's easy to control with proper treatment. But without medical care, patients can perish quickly.

item.title: Efforts pick up in Congress to force vote on release of Jeffrey Epstein files
item.description: There's a renewed bipartisan push in Congress for information about the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein to be released, with some members trying to...

item.title: Epstein accusers expected to hold rally and speak on Capitol Hill Wednesday
item.description: NPR's Steve Inskeep speaks with Lisa Phillips, who says she was sex trafficked by Jeffrey Epstein, about political moves to release more information a...

item.title: Lawmakers push for release of more Epstein files. And, Trump family launches crypto
item.description: Some members of Congress are trying to force a vote to make the Trump administration release more of the Jeffrey Epstein files. And, the Trump family'...

item.title: Hitler's bunker is now just a parking lot. But it's a 'dark tourism' attraction anyway
item.description: Why evil histories sell. A visit to Hitler's bunker, and a deep dive into the economics and ethical quandaries of "dark tourism."

item.title: China's Xi steals the limelight in a defiant push against US-led world order
item.description: President Xi shows off his power and influence in an open challenge to US supremacy and the world order.

item.title: Amazon says it's ending a Prime sharing program. Here are the details.
item.description: Amazon wants users who don't live with a Prime account holder to sign up for their own memberships.

item.title: 9/3: CBS Morning News
item.description: President Trump vows to deploy National Guard to Chicago to help fight crime; North Korea's Kim Jong Un joins leaders at military parade in Beijing.

item.title: Xi, Putin and Kim show united front at huge Chinese military parade
item.description: Speaking during the spectacle in Beijing, China's President Xi Jinping said the world faced a choice between peace and war.

item.title: Jeffrey Epstein survivors hold news conference with lawmakers
item.description: Survivors of late sex offender Jeffrey Epstein's abuse are holding a news conference with members of Congress amid calls for greater transparency on t...

item.title: Race to find survivors after Sudan landslide kills hundreds
item.description: Sunday's landslide followed heavy rain and "levelled" a remote village, a local armed group says.

item.title: Trump cannot use Alien Enemies Act to deport members of Venezuelan gang, appeals court rules
Trump says 11 killed in US strike on drug-carrying vessel from Venezuela
item.description: The Trump administration has signalled a willingness to use military force against drug cartels.

item.title: Survivors of Maine mass shooting and victims’ relatives sue US government alleging negligence
D.C. grand jurors reject latest wave of Justice Dept. indictment requests
item.description: One former federal prosecutor said of the indictment denials by D.C. grand juries that he's "never heard of this happening."

item.title: Bolsonaro's lawyers to present his defence at coup trial
item.description: The former Brazilian president denies conspiring to overturn his 2022 election loss to his left-wing rival, Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva.

item.title: What is phantom energy and how is it draining your electricity?
item.description: Wasted energy is a hidden drain on household electricity but small steps can contribute significantly to lowering costs and emissions.

item.title: Trump says he’s set to order federal intervention in Chicago and Baltimore, despite local opposition
item.description: President Donald Trump says he will direct federal law enforcement intervention to combat crime in Chicago and Baltimore, despite staunch opposition f...
